New Records: Kylian Mbappé became the first France player to score at this year’s UEFA European Championship
Kylian Mbappé netted his first-ever goal at the tournament (6th appearance), with what was his 23rd attempt
Robert Lewandowski became just the third player to score in four different editions of the UEFA European Championship after Cristiano Ronaldo (5) and Luka Modric (4)
Robert Lewandowski is the only player to score at each of the last four Euros (2012, 2016, 2020, 2024)

France had 55 touches in Poland’s penalty area in this match – only England against Denmark in Euro 2020 (56) has a side had more touches in the opposition box on record (since 1980) in a game at the UEFA European Championship
Key Match Events: Kylian Mbappé scored his first-ever goal at the European Championship from the penalty spot early in the second half
Robert Lewandowski scored at the second attempt after Mike Maignan was adjudged to have come off his line to save the first effort
France dominated the ball and grew into the game as the first half went on
Neither side could find a winner, and worryingly for France it was Poland who looked more likely to score in the final 15 minutes
Pre-Game Insights: France had to win to have any chance of finishing top of Group D at Euro 2024
Poland were already guaranteed to finish bottom of the group and were free to play this one with the shackles off
Post-Match Reflections: France failed to win their final group stage match at a major tournament for a ninth consecutive tournament – last winning one at the 2006 World Cup
France come away from this one with plenty of questions to answer and plenty of improvements to be made if they are to go deep in the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kylian Mbappé had attempted more shots without scoring (22) than any France player at the European Championship finals (since at least 1980)
N’Golo Kanté has lost none of his 11 games at the UEFA European Championship (W6 D5), the joint most appearances made by a player in the tournaments history without ever ending on the losing side
Others: France finished second in Group D at Euro 2024, and will face the runners-up from Group E in Düsseldorf on Monday
Poland remain winless in their last eight UEFA European Championship matches (D4 L4), while they avoided defeat in a game in which they conceded first for just a third time at the Euros
